content.description:
Haec ait,1 et MaiaMaia, -ae, f.: Maia (the mother of Mercury) genitumgenitus, -us, m. = natus, -us demittitdemitto, -ere = mitto, -ere ab alto, 
ut terrae, utque novae pateantpateo, -ere: to be open KarthaginisKarthago, -inis, f.: Carthage arces 
hospitiohospitium, -i, n.: hospitality Teucris.
 1:The god Jupiter is the subject of ait.↩
content.question: In the passage, the clause ut...Teucris specifies

choices.label: how incredible it was to allow the Trojans into Carthage
why the Trojans should be allowed into Carthage
when Carthage was opened up to Maia’s son
the reason for sending Maia’s son to Carthage

content.answer: the reason for sending Maia’s son to Carthage

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
